body: Provide an introduction to your project. Explain what it does, why it's useful, and who the target audience is. You can also include a high-level overview of its features.
List the key features of your project. Use bullet points for clarity.
Provide instructions on how to get started with your project. This section should cover prerequisites and installation steps.
List any software or tools that users need to install before they can use your project.
Provide step-by-step instructions on how to install and set up your project.
Explain how to use your project. Include code examples, if applicable.
Provide guidelines for others who may want to contribute to your project. Include information on how to submit bug reports, feature requests, or pull requests.
Specify the license for your project and include any licensing-related information.
Give credit to any individuals or projects that inspired or assisted your work.
Provide contact information or links to your social media profiles, website, or email address for users who want to reach out or learn more about you.
**Note**: You can remove or expand sections based on your project's specific requirements. Be sure to replace the placeholders with your actual content.
